com.fluidops.iwb.user
Interface UserManager

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Implementing Classes:
UserManagerImpl
public interface UserManager
extends java.rmi.Remote

The (new) IWB User Management Interface. Wraps the fbase user management functionality, by interpreting roles etc.

Author:
msc

Nested Class Summary
static class UserManager.EditorialWorkflow
           
static class UserManager.UIComponent
           
static class UserManager.ValueAccessLevel
          Resource access levels: - READ: user is allowed to read the resource - WRITE_LIMITED: user has READ access to the resource + limited write (no widgets) - WRITE_FULL: user has full access to the resource page (modulo widgets etc. that may be blocked)

Method Detail

hasValueAccess

boolean hasValueAccess(org.openrdf.model.Value v,
                       UserManager.ValueAccessLevel al)
Checks whether the user has (at least) the passed value access level (order: READ < WRITE_LIMITED < WRITE).

Parameters:
the - value to check
the - access type to verify
Returns:
true if and only if the user has access to the given value according to the access rules

getValueAccessLevel

UserManager.ValueAccessLevel getValueAccessLevel(org.openrdf.model.Value v)
Returns the maximum access level for the user and the specified value.

Parameters:
the - value to check
the - access type to verify
Returns:
true if and only if the user has access to the given value according to the access rules

hasAPIAccess

boolean hasAPIAccess(com.fluidops.api.misc.ApiMethod apiMethod,
                     com.fluidops.api.security.SessionContext sc)
To be called prior to executing an API method. If the user does not have access to the API, then an exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
ApiMethod - the api method to check
sc - optional context to register against, if null user context is used
Returns:
true if and only if the user has access to the given API according to the access rules

hasServletAccess

boolean hasServletAccess(java.lang.Class<?> servletClass,
                         com.fluidops.api.security.SessionContext sc)
To be called in each servlet prior to delivering data. Not sure if we want to have it, but it may be a usefool tool to disable some servlets for users (e.g., RDF Export). However, components that rely on the servlets may break. Therefore, you should use this feature with care and basically allow all the components to every user.

Parameters:
servletClass - the servlet class
sc - optional context to register against, if null user context is used
Returns:
true if and only if user has access to the the given servlet class according to the access rules

hasWidgetAccess

boolean hasWidgetAccess(java.lang.Class<?> widgetClass,
                        com.fluidops.api.security.SessionContext sc)
Checks if the user has access to some widget.

Parameters:
widgetClass - the widget class
sc - optional context to register against, if null user context is used
Returns:
true if and only if the user has access to the given API according to the access rules

hasUIComponentAccess

boolean hasUIComponentAccess(UserManager.UIComponent component,
                             com.fluidops.api.security.SessionContext sc)
Checks if the user has access to some UI component (such as a button).

Parameters:
component - the UI component
sc - optional context to register against, if null user context is used
Returns:
true if and only if the user has access to the given API according to the access rules

hasEditorialWorkflowAccess

boolean hasEditorialWorkflowAccess(UserManager.EditorialWorkflow action,
                                   com.fluidops.api.security.SessionContext sc)
Checks if the user has the right to perform some action in the editorial workflow (such as approve, publish).

Parameters:
action - in the editorial workflow
sc - optional context to register against, if null user context is used
Returns:
true if the user the right

hasFileAccess

boolean hasFileAccess(java.lang.String file,
                      com.fluidops.api.security.SessionContext sc,
                      boolean enforceExists)
Checks if the user has access to some file residing on the server.

Parameters:
file - the file name (including path) on the server
sc - optional context to register against, if null user context is used
enforceExists - true if access should only be granted if file exists
Returns:
true if and only if the user has access to the given file (in that case, he is allowed to read and write)

hasQueryRight

boolean hasQueryRight(ReadDataManagerImpl.SparqlQueryType qt,
                      com.fluidops.api.security.SessionContext sc)
Is the user allowed to submit queries of a certain type over the search input.

Returns:

hasQueryPrivileges

                           ReadDataManagerImpl.SparqlQueryType qt,
                           java.lang.String securityToken)
Convenience method to determine if user has query privileges, which can be used from servlets, i.e. SparqlServlet or HybridSearchServlet.

qt -
securityToken -
Returns:

boolean isLoggedIn(com.fluidops.api.security.SessionContext sc)
Checks if the user is logged in or not, i.e. if the UserContext exists.

Parameters:
sc - optional context to register against, if null user context is used
Returns:
true if and only if the user is logged in

getRoles

java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRoles(com.fluidops.api.security.SessionContext sc)
Get the user roles. Contains special handling for the IWB user modes, such as assigning admin role to users if user management is turned off.

Parameters:
sc - optional context to register against, if null user context is used
Returns:
the list of roles

getUserURI

org.openrdf.model.URI getUserURI(com.fluidops.api.security.SessionContext sc)
Get the user's URI. The users URI is the global identifier for the user and identifies its profile page. Implementation should *always* return a valid URI (not null, user Vocabulary.SYSTEM.UNKNOWN_USER as a fallback when the user is not known (or not logged in).

Parameters:
sc - optional context to register against, if null user context is used
Returns:
the URI of the user

getUserName

java.lang.String getUserName(com.fluidops.api.security.SessionContext sc)
Get the user's name.

Parameters:
sc - optional context to register against, if null user context is used
Returns:
the URI of the user
